document.heading: Alcoholic Beverage Control Board Rules of Procedure Amendments of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-146, the “Alcoholic Beverage Control Board Rules of Procedure Amendments of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-165, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first, amended first and second readings on July 29, 1980, September 16, 1980 and September 30, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 21, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-267 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
